title: [Self-Directed] Acoustic Metamaterial Sound Absorber Design: Mathematical Modeling and Deep Learning Applications

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational physics, calculus, matrix operations, and Python programming comprehension
context.additional_context: Project-based learning where learners understand acoustic metamaterial design principles through mathematical approaches and apply deep learning-based structural optimization methods

learning_goals: Acquisition of mathematical modeling skills for metamaterial sound absorbers based on acoustic wave equations.
Design of Fibonacci sequence-based resonant structures and explanation of multi-resonance peak coupling principles.

Within a 6-month course, learners can implement a multilayer perceptron (MLP) model with three or more layers using Python and TensorFlow/Keras, achieve sound absorption coefficient prediction accuracy with RMSE below 0.15, and evaluate model performance based on cross-validation (K-fold) results.
Design of a structural parameter optimization process applying inverse-design neural networks (Tandem NN).
Completion of a two-stage resonance unit design project to achieve over 80% sound absorption efficiency in the 300â€“800 Hz band.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
